subject: Simsonn Vamp Pro (3x)/Simson Pedal X Pro Ultra Controllerbox
description_text:
Dear Sir or Madam,

 

I purchased the Simson Pro X Ultra pedals on Amazon (February 2025), already
including the new Simsonn Controller. The pedals have been working perfectly
since February.

Now I have also purchased the Haptic Reactors (1st December) Vam Pro Motors
on Amazon and connected them but nothing happens. No matter whether I select
calibration or the vibration test, there is no response. The Simson Manager
is up to date (Version 2.1.2).

The pedals have always been used via USB so far, and there have never been
any problems. Even now, the pedals are still working as they should.

However, I noticed that when I plug the power connector into the Simson
controller, you can see a short circuit. Please see the attached video (that
happens every time when you plug in the connector into the Controller box. I
do not know whats wrong (damaged Power Supply or Damaged controller box or
all 3 Haptic Motors?)?

 

The Simsonn controller had never been operated with a separate power supply
before (only via the USB port). Only when I wanted to try out the haptic
reactors.
The Simsonn Manager showed me a firmware update for CPU1 (or CPU2, I'm not
sure), which I carried out and completed. I believe that the short circuit
only happened after that. The firmware version was, I think, 6/2025
(sometime in the summer).


It is very disappointing that I have to go through this experience now. I
was actually looking forward to the Christmas holidays.
Hopefully you can help me

 

 

Best Regards

Christoph Lahodny

conversations.body_text: Hi Christoph. lahodny,    It is normal to see sparks when plugging in the 24V independent power supply. This is not a short circuit, but the charging process of the capacitors inside the motors. Since it uses a 24V supply, there are no safety issues, and it will not damage the mainboard—please rest assured.     Additionally, your software has been updated to Simsonn Manager 2.1.2, and the firmware should also be updated to CPU1: 2.0.5, CPU2: 2.0.4 before testing. You can also use SimHub.  If you encounter an issue where the vibration does not stop, please refer to the solution provided below.           If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.           https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting     https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding
I do not have the problem that the motors do not stop working, but rather that they do not start at all! Nothing happens—neither in the Simsonn Manager nor in SimHub.

Dear Sir or Madam,

First of all, I would like to point out that I am having a problem logging in to the support ticket website (see screenshots).

When I try to register, I receive an error message stating that the email address is already in use. However, when I try to reset the password using this same email address, I receive an error message saying that I do not have permission to do so.

 

The third screenshot shows that my motors are not marked as “Power Connected” at all (right side oft he screenshot, left side is a picture of your homepage). On the product images on your website, this appears differently.

 

Furthermore, I do NOT have version CPU1 2.0.5 and CPU2 2.0.4 installed, but instead CPU1 2.0.2 and CPU2 2.0.0.

However, when I switch to upgrade mode, no further updates are available.
Could you please provide the firmware files along with instructions on how to manually update the firmware?

 

Best regards,



Christoph Lahodny

Hi Christoph. lahodny,  Please first uninstall the existing SIMSONN Manager software from your computer. Then visit our official website to download and install the latest version, SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2.exe. After installation, open the software and go to Settings → Update → Check for Updates, then follow the instructions to install the latest version.            https://www.simsonn.com/pages/download

Dear Sir or Madam,

The firmware upgrade was successful, and the haptic motors are now activating.

However, I am still experiencing significant technical issues.
As soon as the haptic motors are connected and powered, I encounter severe input-related problems. Throttle, brake, and clutch inputs are either not recognized or become stuck. Additionally, the steering input intermittently freezes (the steering wheel physically returns to 0 degrees, but in-game—regardless of the title—the steering remains offset to the left).

Furthermore, on my Simagic Alpha EVO Pro wheel base, the connected Simagic GT NEO wheel—connected to the PC via the wheel base using USB passthrough and recognized as a USB device—gets disconnected repeatedly.
All of these issues occur exclusively when the haptic motors are connected and supplied with power.

I was able to resolve the input and disconnection issues described above.
However, the remaining problem is that the haptic motors behave inconsistently: regardless of whether I test them using Simsonn Manager or SimHub, they sometimes do not activate at all (clicking “Test” produces no response). In other cases, a motor becomes “stuck” and continues running for several seconds longer than defined by the test sequence.

At this point, I am unsure how to proceed and am considering returning the Vam Pro‘se.

For troubleshooting, I have already performed the following measures:

1.	Grounded the controller box and connected it to the protective earth of a standard wall outlet (ground only).
2.	Installed 3D-printed spacers for the motors to ensure mechanical isolation.
3.	Added ferrite cores to all data and power cables of the controller box, as well as to the pedal RJ45 cable.
4.	Grounded the wheel base.
5.	Grounded the aluminum rig.
6.	Removed the controller box from the aluminum rig and placed it separately on the floor to avoid any mechanical or electrical contact with the rig.
7.	Physically separated power cables from data/USB cables.

The PC itself is not grounded separately, as it is already grounded through the power supply and its connection to the standard wall outlet.

Do you have any further technical suggestions or recommendations?

Kind regards,
Christoph

Hi Christoph. lahodny,  Please uninstall the old version of SIMSONN Manager from your computer, then download and install the latest SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2. Go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals-firmware → pedals and select the firmware for your pedal model (proxultra.sfu for ProX Ultra, or prox.sfu for other models). After updating, the firmware should display CPU1: 2.0.5 and CPU2: 2.0.4. Please retest the pedal after the update.       https://www.simsonn.com/pages/download
